      • getIsApplet

        public static boolean getIsApplet()
        return the static member indicating whether this is a application or applet. This static member controls other Util about whether certain thing can be done. For instance, Util.prt will put output in a SESSION.OUT file if its an application, but it cannot do this as an applet because file access is not allowed by applets via the sandbox.
        Returns:
        The current state of isApplet variable;

      • prt

        public static void prt(java.io.PrintStream out,
                       java.lang.String txt)
        prt takes the input text and prints it out. It might go into the MSDOS window or to the SESSION.OUT file depending on the state of the debug flag. The "main" should decide on debug or not, set the flag and then all of the output will be available on the window or in the file. The file is really useful when something does not work because the user can e-mail it to us and a full debug listing is available for postmortem
        Parameters:
        out - The output PrintStream to send output,
        txt - The output text

      • sqlEscape

        public static java.lang.StringBuilder sqlEscape(java.lang.StringBuilder s)
        Escape a string for use in an SQL query. The string is returned enclosed in single quotes with any dangerous characters escaped. This is modeled after escape_string_for_mysql from the MySQL API. Beware that the characters '%' and '_' are not escaped. They do not have special meaning except in LIKE clauses.
        Parameters:
        s - The string to be escaped
        Returns:
        The escaped string

      • date

        public static java.sql.Date date(int year,
                                 int month,
                                 int day)
        Create a SQL date from a year, month, day int. The SQL date comes from MS since 1970 but the "gregorianCalendar" Class likes to use MONTH based on 0=January. This does the right Thing so I wont forget later!
        Parameters:
        year - The year
        month - The month
        day - The day of month
        Returns:
        Date in sql form

                                  int month,
                                  int day,
                                  int hr,
                                  int min,
                                  int sec)

        Parameters:
        year - The year
        month - The month
        day - The day of month
        hr - The hour of day
        min - The minute

      • stringToDate

        public static java.sql.Date stringToDate(java.lang.String s)
        Convert a yyyy/mm/dd string to a full java.sql.Date. No times are permitted. If the yy is two digits it is converted by the rule of 80 (80-99 > 1900+yy), yy < 80, year=2000+yy. For more flexible conversions including ones with times seed seedToDate2. Ether slash or hyphen can be used to separate the fields.
        Parameters:
        s - string to decode to a sql date yyyy/mm/dd
        Returns:
        The sql date from the string

      • stringToDate2

        public static java.util.Date stringToDate2(java.lang.String s)
        Convert a yyyy/mm/dd string to a full Date Of the form. This allows both / and - date separators. Any parts of the time may be omitted. The position between the date and time can be a Space, colon, slash, hyphen, period or Capital T. Examples:
        yyyy/mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm:ss, or
        yyyy-mm/dd hh:mm:ss or
        yyyy,doy hh:mm:ss
        yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm
        yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm
        Parameters:
        s - The string to encode
        Returns:
        The java.util.Date representing the string or a date in 1970 if the string is bad.

      • isValidSeedName

        public static boolean isValidSeedName(java.lang.String name)
        static method that insures a seedname makes some sense. 1) Name is 12 characters long nnssssscccll. 2) All characters are characters, digits, spaces, question marks or dashes 3) Network code contain blanks 4) Station code must be at least 3 characters long 5) Channel codes must be characters in first two places
        Parameters:
        name - A seed string to check
        Returns:
        True if seename passes tests.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        True if seename passes tests.

      • getSystemNumber

        public static int getSystemNumber()
        Get the system number from the "Node" property or failing that from the end of the SystemName(). If the systemName() does not end in digits, then the system number would be zero which is only good on a one server Edge/CWB setup. Hence an warning message is printed here. If # appears in the Node, then the system number is before the #.
        Returns:
        The system number or zero if the system does not end with an up to two digit number

      • sbToLong

      • getHashSB

        public static long getHashSB(java.lang.StringBuilder sb)
        Generate a java like hash code from a StringBuilder without making a string. This does create the same hash code if it is converted to int, but I have left it as long for our purposes. Normally this is used in IndexBlock to create the upper 40 bits of the hash code of seedname and julian date (seed IndexBlock.getHash(seedname,julian) for the only known usage of this routine. This will NOT generate the same hash code as String if the string length is more than 12 characters
        Parameters:
        sb - The seedname (normally) to hash
        Returns:
        a hash code s[0]*31^(n-1) + s[1]*31^(n-2) + ... + s[n-1] per String.hashCode()

      • stringBuilderReadline

        public static int stringBuilderReadline(java.io.BufferedReader br,
                                        java.lang.StringBuilder out)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Do a readline from a BufferedReader but output to a StringBuilder provided by the user 
         Sample usage :
   StringBuilder line = new StringBuilder(100);
   BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(filename));
   for(;;) {
     int len = Util.stringBuilderReadline(in, line);
     if(len < 0) break;
     // Do something with the line
   }
   in.close();
        Parameters:
        br - A bufferred reader of characters
        out - The users supplied StringBuilder
        Returns:
        -1 if EOF found, else the length of the line in bytes
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • isModifyDateNewer

        public static long isModifyDateNewer(java.lang.String configFile,
                                     long lastModified)
        CHeck a file (normally a configuration file) to see if its modify data is now newer than one the caller is tracking. 
         long lastModified =0;    // class variable to track mod date of configuration file
 .
 .
 Some loop which checks the modify date
 long lastMod = Util.isModifyDateNewer(configFile, lastModified);
 if(lastMod == 0)  {
   prta("config file modify date is the same!"+Util.ascdatetime2(lastMod));
   return;
 }
 else if(lastMod > 0) {
   lastModified = lastMod;
 }
 else {prta(" *** config file does not exist! "+configFile); return;}
        Parameters:
        configFile - The the modify date of the file against a last modified date
        lastModified - The last time the caller thinks the file was modified
        Returns:
        The last modified date if the file has a modify data greater than lastModified, user should store this for the next call, else zero

      • curlit

        public static long curlit(java.lang.String url,
                          java.lang.String file,
                          int minlen,
                          java.io.PrintStream par)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Issue the given curl command and put the results in the file. If the file is below minlen, try again.
        Parameters:
        line - The curl command
        file - The file to get the results
        minlen - The minimum length of a successful curl, if it is not this length it is reissued.
        par - A logging printStream
        Returns:
        the length of the result
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If one is thrown by the subprocess.
